utACK 1f3b3fd48bb6c5787893529862430bd77b2c7fb3

Another thing to consider here now may be to add some information to the window title. After all if there are multiple open it may be useful to distinguish them in taskbars etc.

I'm not sure on what to add though; transaction id seems to be of limited usefulness. Maybe date/recipient/amount.

Numbering doesn't seem more useful to me than just keeping them with the same window title. It needs to actually identify the transaction.\n(also this opens up issues with reusing or not reusing numbers, I'd rather just add (part of) the transaction id in that case)\n
What about the shortened transaction id (middle truncated). Something like `4d8fad...8dd9f9` for `4d8fad408da55d4b54e3be97960db06d78489f5984e0a6e8ada082295e8dd9f9`?\n
Full tx ID. window manager/... will shorten it if needed (ie. Transaction details: tx_id).\n

@jonasschnelli: Interesting, do you know why is this necessary specifically here, how about the other places where we use `setAttribute(Qt::WA_DeleteOnClose)`?

(excluding the splash window and the shutdown wind

From the QDialog documentation:
http://doc.qt.io/qt-5/qdialog.html#modal-prop  "By default, this property is false"

It's only `dlg->exec()` which sets it to true, which we don't use anymore (here). I don't think we need to set it.

Edit: screenshot looks good, I do think we should prefix the title `Transaction details:` though so we don't get an all-hex title :)
Right. `setModal()` is not required. Was a local issue here.\n
Using "Details for" instead of "Transaction Details" would not truncate the window title (at least on OSX). Tested ACK 17a6a217867603f349de676739f072c789c3918f.
Yes, Abbreviating to "Details for %s" makes sense, will do that, it was just that having the whole title hex was a bit too cypherpunk even for me :)\n
Added a new commit that puts the tx id in the window title (as well as removes the old "Transaction details" translation string).\n
